VIA NET.WORKS are an American-based internet service provider (ISP) who have grown throughout the world by acquisition of local ISPs. At the stage of their growth that Perot Systems became involved with them, VIA NET.WORKS were looking to consolidate all the individual ISPs into the VIA NET.WORKS corporation so that all the individual units were using the same systems for billing and provisioning (providing the service to customers).
Perot Systems were asked to audit the existing - overrunning - programme and provide a 'road-map' showing how to deliver the programme into all the individual operating units on time, and in such a way that the delivered systems would be culturally acceptable. I was one of the two Perot Systems employees who were asked to participate in this consultancy challenge.
The consultancy consisted initially of visiting all of the European based operating units to establish the current picture in terms of systems already in place, and understanding and acceptance of the programme which was already running within VIA NET.WORKS.
The deliverables from this consultancy work were advice and recommendations to get the programme back on track with an architecture which would work, and in such a way that the eventual systems would be acceptable to all the stakeholders in the programme.
The deliverables were presented to the board of VIA NET.WORKS in their American base, and as a result of the deliverables, major changes were made to the programme, and Perot Systems were asked to become involved in the programme management.
